it.ma.polimi.briscola.model.deck

Class AbstractCardListWrapper<CARD extends Card>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.ma.polimi.briscola.model.deck.AbstractCardListWrapper<CARD>
  • Type Parameters:
    CARD - the type parameter, extends Card
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CardListWrapper<CARD>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDeck, Briscola2PHand, Briscola2PPile, Briscola2PSurface

    public abstract class AbstractCardListWrapper<CARD extends Card>
extends java.lang.Object
implements CardListWrapper<CARD>
    Abstract class providing a default implementation of CardListWrapper interface. It wraps a cardList and provides some convenience mehods to manipulate it. Descendants of this class can either have a maximum number of allowed cards or can contain any number of cards. This is resolved at runtime invoking the getMaxNumCardsAllowedInList overridden by its descendents. By default returns null (i.e. number of cards not limited) Concrete Descendants must provide a buildCardInstance method implementation, so as to allow this class to properly instantiate CARD objects.

      • AbstractCardListWrapper

      • AbstractCardListWrapper

        public AbstractCardListWrapper(java.lang.String list)
        Instantiates a new Abstract card list wrapper from the string passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        list - The string representing the card list with the convention that each card is represented by a card number followed by the card suit. The leftmost card represents the lowest-indexed card in the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number of cards contained in the argument is greater than the max number of allowed cards

      • AbstractCardListWrapper

        public AbstractCardListWrapper(java.util.List<CARD> cards)
        Instantiates a new Abstract card list wrapper from the list of cards passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        cards - The list of cards to be wrapped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number of cards contained in the argument is greater than the max number of allowed cards

      • buildCardInstance

        public abstract CARD buildCardInstance(java.lang.String num,
                                       java.lang.String suit)
        Abstract method used to get an instance of the generic type CARD based on two Strings representing the number and the suit (respectively) of the desired card
        Parameters:
        num - String representing the number of the card, its value must be among the cardNumber values in the CARD associated CardNumber enum (name convention CARDCardNumber, e.g. NeapolitanCardNumber)
        suit - String representing the suit of the card, its value must be among the cardSuit values in the CARD associated CardSuit enum (name convention CARDCardSuit, e.g. NeapolitanCardSuit)
        Returns:
        A CARD object having the desired number and suit
